rooms.description: A welcoming entrance hall aligned with the main road, oriented towards the North-east to adhere to Vastu principles. Provides space for decorative items.
Spacious living area placed in the South-west quadrant for balanced energy flow. Windows on the East and West sides allow natural light while maintaining privacy.
Adjacent to the living room with a partitioned space ensuring family interactions during meals. Designed with Vastu guidelines in mind by aligning dining table towards the North for auspiciousness.
Located in the South-east quadrant as per traditional Kerala design and Vastu norms. Features an integrated ventilation system to prevent odors from spreading into living spaces.
Placed towards the North-west corner for privacy, ensuring proper water drainage and alignment with Vastu principles.
Primary bedroom designed in the North-east quadrant. Incorporates a small balcony or veranda to ensure fresh air intake and natural light.

A dedicated space allocated near the living area for remote work. It is designed with minimalistic interiors and placed in a quiet zone of the house to ensure focus while following Vastu guidelines by facing the East.

openings.description: Traditional Kerala-style entrance ensuring smooth flow and adherence to Vastu principles by aligning with the positive energy direction.
Large windows allowing ample natural light while preserving privacy. Positioned according to Vastu norms for enhancing room positivity.
Ventilation and light window in the kitchen as per traditional design ensuring natural light flow.
Main door of the bedroom aligned with Vastu principles for optimal energy flow and privacy.
